intro: Euphrasia hirtella lepida, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Its flowering period occurs in spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators.
